newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HKTel conservative on IDD cut, rival says.
newsitem.headline: HKTel conservative on IDD cut, rival says.

text.p: Hong Kong Telecommunications Ltd has probably lost more international traffic to new competitors than it acknowledges, a rival said on Tuesday.
Leslie Harris, president of New T&T Hong Kong Ltd, said on Tuesday that HongKong Telecom had likely conceded around 20 percent of the international call traffic to new competitors.
HongKong Telecom recently acknowledged losing around 15 percent of international traffic to competitors.
"My views are it's probably a higher figure than 15 percent. It's probably more likely around 20 percent," Harris told reporters at a telecoms conference.
Harris said New T&T, the telecommunications arm of Wharf (Holdings) Ltd, was aiming to snare about 10 percent of total international call traffic by the end of its fiscal year next March.
The two other new competitors, owned by Hutchison Whampoa Ltd and New World Development Ltd, also hope to grab similar market shares, Harris said.

During a recent cut-price promotion, New T&T said it expanded the number of new customer connections by 18 percent and the length of total calls made by 36 percent but still made money. "We don't do loss-leaders," Harris said.
